issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Cloud unable to launch instances; Walrus left "view" of CLC which caused NCs not be be able to download manifest file

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Create volume requests are failing in my last 2 most recent ebs_extended sequence runs using Netapp cmode. CLC shows SC service state in ENABLED but SC may have failed to transition to that state? Have reproduced twice by re-running the test sequence. Will continue to debug tomorrow. 
Thanks,
-M

{code}
2013-06-04 15:57:11 DEBUG 000001904 Volumes                  | Creating volume
2013-06-04 15:57:11 ERROR 000001905 SoapMarshallingHandler   | Failed to marshall response:
2013-06-04 15:57:11 ERROR 000001905 SoapMarshallingHandler   | org.apache.axiom.om.OMException: com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxEOFException: Unexpected EOF in prolog
                          |  at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,0]
org.apache.axiom.om.OMException: com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxEOFException: Unexpected EOF in prolog
{code}
fields.summary: Failed to marshall response to create volumes request
fields.environment:
GIT_HASH	d0705ef99973192bdbbac92994c0c0d529657da1

10.111.1.177	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS UI]
10.111.5.3	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.5.5	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.5.17	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]

MEMO
CLOUD_OPTS=--debug --db-home=/usr/pgsql-9.1/

EXTRA_REPO=pgrpms http://mirror.eucalyptus-systems.com/mirrors/pgrpm-91/redhat/rhel-6-x86_64/
EXTRA_REPO=elrepo http://mirror.eucalyptus-systems.com/mirrors/elrepo/el6/x86_64/

USE_EPEL_REPO=YES

LOCAL_EUCA2OOLS_REPO=http://repos.fedorapeople.org/repos/gholms/cloud/epel-6/x86_64/

EXTRA_PKG=postgresql91-server PyGreSQL java-1.7.0-openjdk-devel

EBS_STORAGE_MANAGER=SANManager
SAN_PROVIDER=NetappProvider
NETAPP_MODE=Cluster
USE_MULTIPATHING=YES

First round of tests have passed marking as fixed. Will continue to run/re-run the tests and will re-open if seen again.

I was able to reproduce this case on a fully distributed system running DASmanager.

System is available here:
192.168.51.37	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[UI CLC]
192.168.51.38	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[WS]
192.168.51.39	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[SC00]
192.168.51.40	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[CC00]
192.168.51.41	CENTOS	6.4	64	REPO	[NC00]
I am on the systems now. Checking that we are seeing the exact same bug. The EOF error is not exactly enough to determine this is the same thing.
Yes, seeing HTTP 307 Temp redirect back to 51.37/services/Storage

We have determined that this can occur on any remote java component (SC or Walrus were tested).   Created a script to reproduce the problem (semi-reliably).  Can still have this situation but reduced from around 25% of the time to less than 1% (0.8%).   We could still use a better error message for this situation.

It can only occur on startup of the initial system or upon a restart of the components.  Another restart will work.
You'll see the failed to marshall response in the log (which could be for other reasons or a false positive).  Upon deeper inspection you can look at the wire (tcpdump) and see a 307 redirect from the affected component.   Another symptom is failure to create volumes in the case of the SC or failure of S3 for Walrus.

It appears as the CLC seeing the affected components as ENABLED, but the SC or Walrus component is actually in NOTREADY.

The most recent patch may reduce the likelihood of this issue occurring, but we have still seen this in test systems since the patch was applied. This should continue to be investigated and documented. 
The systems we have seen this on were recovered by bouncing the remote service. In this case on the storage controller (service eucalyptus-cloud restart). These systems faulted during initialization, and once restarted did not fall back into this state. The first attempt to create EBS volumes within that partition failed with the 'Failed to marshall response', and using 'ngrep port 8773' allowed us to see the temp redirect:
##
T 10.111.5.22:8773 -> 10.111.5.13:41255 [AP]
  HTTP/1.1 307 Temporary Redirect..Location: http://10.111.5.13:8773/internal/Storage....                                                                                        
#####

Thanks,
-M

[~hspencer], this will possibly happen upon startup or restart of a remote java component.   What was the topology of the test?   Does this test cycle through a number of iterations of starting a cloud, or just one start and then cycling through volume create, etc... ?   How many times did you run this test?   Does this reproduce every time or was it a one time issue?

Hey [~tjcramer],

Actually, this happened when my cloud was running.  No components had been started/restarted when I was running this test.  I did stop/start the eucalyptus-cloud process on the CLC/Walrus machines hours before to get around issue EUCA-6544.  

The setup is as follows:

* 2 x CLC/Walrus
* 1 x SC/CC
* 1 x CC
* 3 x NCs

I ran the test back to back, and it happened both times.  The eutester testcase (instancetest.py) just starts a new instance when it runs each test.  The tests I am running are as follows:

* BasicInstanceChecks
* MetaData
* Reboot

None of those tests restart the cloud or any cloud components.  It just focuses on instances.  Hope this helps.  Let me know if you need any additional information.
[~hspencer], thanks!  This is great info.  I think this is different, but if its reproducible that's helpful.
QA contact was [~mclark], not sure who this should go to.
This has not been seen in QA in the last 2 release test cycles. Closing as fixed.
